Text:
The ransom note brings us to a back street of the
royal capital.

It only takes a little while before I sense two
presences approaching.
Something flies in my direction,
which I catch in one hand and glance at.
Is this...Alexia's shoe?
And then, two men appear from a back alley.

Hey there, chick magnet. What're you doing with
Princess Alexia's shoe?
Ooh, and it contains traces of magic.

Both are in the armor of the Knight Order. There's no
doubt they're the ones who interrogated me before.
I see. That's what you're trying to do.
Yeah, that's right.
The knights unabashedly sneer at my words.

If you'd cracked sooner, we wouldn't have had to get
into this mess.

The two wield their swords and brazenly close the
distance separating them from me.

Cid Kagenou. You're under arrest for the abduction of
a princess.

Don't fight back. Well, not that you could put up
much of a fight—
The next moment.
Hmm?
Who the hell...
Agh...augh!
Eek!
You bastard, you'll pay—!

Before the man can finish speaking, his left arm
flies off.
Agh...augh?
Aaaaggghhhh!

The knight shrieks as blood gushes from his left arm,
which he clutches.

D-Don't think you can get away with hurting the
Knight Order, you swine...! I-It's over for you!

I leisurely tread the man's trail of blood and draw
closer.
But you don't have to worry anymore.
Because when dawn breaks...
...everything will be done.
The man's head is flung into the sky,
and Cid turns around, blood raining down on him.
Beta shudders at the sight.
But Cid is no longer there in his school uniform.
Instead, there's Shadow, head to toe in ebony.

Adorned in an inky bodysuit and boots, he holds
a black katana in his hand as his coat sways in the
breeze.

His hood hangs over his forehead, hiding the upper
half of his face. Only the lower half sees light.

The only real visible parts of him are his mouth and
the red eyes peering out from the darkness.

After nearly fainting upon seeing his commanding and
arresting silhouette, Beta hastily retrieves "The
Chronicles of Master Shadow" from between her
breasts and draws a rough sketch of the scene.

At that moment, the great Master Shadow turned to the
foolish knights with speed beyond human perception.
Then, speaking in his noble voice, he delivered a
striking blow...

On an unrelated note, these drawings and lists of his
catchphrases comprise the wallpaper in Beta's
bedroom.

Writing a new entry in "The Chronicles of Master
Shadow" every night before bed is one of her
greatest joys in life.
Just then...

The roar of a distant explosion drags her back to
reality.
Is that Delta...?
Nocturne has begun. Let's go, Beta.
O-Okay! Coming!

Beta stuffs the notepad back into her cleavage and
dashes after him.

And, of course, Shadow is totally unaware that she's
done any of that in the first place.

Eek... What the hell are you? We've done nothing to
deserve this!
A sea of blood.

That's what this is. And appropriately, a man is
screaming in the middle of it all. "It" has come
unannounced.

Without any warning or stating its reasons, "it" bursts
through the wall and commences its slaughter. Yet
another man becomes prey to its black blade.

No one wants to fight "it." The men wish to make a
hasty escape and nothing more.
But "it" is blocking the only exit.
H-Help...!
Aaaaagghhh!

His body is split down the middle, sliced from the
top of his skull to his crotch. Blood bursts from
each side as the two halves fall to the right and
left.

As "it" submerges its body in blood, it catches the
falling drops tenderly.

"It" might have the appearance of a woman, but her
temperament is of a devil.

Upon noticing there are few prey left in the area,
"it" extends its weapon, elongating the black
blade.

Without exaggeration, the katana literally extends
far enough to smash through the wall.
With a mighty swing, "it" destroys the building
and everything inside of it.
It has begun.

From atop a clock tower, an alluring elf watches the
complete annihilation and fall of a building. It's a
joke, almost.

The breeze tousles her long golden locks,
glistenening in the dark of the night.
Oh, Delta... She always overdoes it.

She sighs, shaking her head. But she can't undo
what's already done.

Alpha looks over the capital from the top of the
tower.

The entire capital begins moving frantically.
Everything commences as planned.

And most of the attention is directed at Delta, who
just hacked a building to bits.

I have to give it to Delta for making it easier for
the others to start...

If she could just ignore the victims, she could admit
Delta's moves are exceptional.
//カットシーン再生
